comments:
Using Build F1 (2020521)
Redhat 7.2, GTK2, KDE 2.2-10

(This only happens in GTK2)

1. Clear workspace (may not be necessary)
2. In Eclipse, click the "Open a prespective" icon on the left toolbar.
3. Select "Other.." and a dialog will pop-up
4. Double-click (important) on any perspective (say, java)
5. The perspective will come up and immediately after an internal error shows up

NOTE: This will NOT happen if you select one then click 'Ok', only when you
double-click. 

The error dialog says:
Internal Error
An SWT error has occured.
It is recommended to exit the workbench.
Subsequent errors may happen and may terminate the workbench without warning.
See error log for details.
Exit Workspace? (Y/N)

The following message is printed to standard output:
Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Widget is disposed

The log file (shown below) refers to a Table. I'm assuming this table is the one
I double clicked on to select the perspective. (I could be wrong)

The .log file contains the following:
!SESSION May 23, 2002 14:03:56.368 ---------------------------------------------
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM build cxia32131-20020410 (JIT enabled: jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -feature
org.eclipse.platform -install
file:/bluebird/teamswt/cdentrem/eclipse0521gtk/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 4 May 23, 2002 14:03:56.370
!MESSAGE Reference action not found: additions
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 4 May 23, 2002 14:04:10.100
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 May 23, 2002 14:04:10.103
!MESSAGE Widget is disposed
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Widget is disposed
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:289)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.getDisplay(Control.java(Compiled
Code))
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java(Compiled

        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java(Compiled

        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.getColumnCount(Table.java:484)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer$2.getColumnCount(TableViewer.java:347)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewerImpl.activateCellEditor(TableViewerImpl.java:79)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewerImpl.access$1(TableViewerImpl.java:73)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewerImpl$4.run(TableViewerImpl.java:249)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:29)
        at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:93)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1356)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1226)

        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:739)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:200)

        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:476)

Since it's no longer repeatable, we will not do any more investigation of 
this for R2.0. However, Boris thinks there may still be an underlying error 
case which we should handle, so I'm marking this as LATER to remind 
us to look at it again.
Post 2.0. Re-opening bug reports for review.

I am assuming this is a bug in the old implementation of Table (GtkCList) and
I am going to close this bug. Check Bug#25212.
